src.peoplesoft_api module

class src.peoplesoft_api.PeopleSoftAPI

Bases: object

A class to interact with the PeopleSoft API.

This class provides methods to perform GET requests to the PeopleSoft API, retrieve records, and manage API catalogs.

base_url

The base URL for the PeopleSoft API.

Type:

str

get(url: str, params: dict = {})

Sends a GET request to the specified URL with parameters.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The URL to send the request to.

  • params (dict, optional) – The request parameters.

Returns:

The response from the API.

Return type:

requests.Response

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during the request.

get_catalog(endpoint: str = 'open-api-catalog') → None

Retrieves the API catalog and initializes several attributes based on the response.

Attributes initialized:

self.catalog_json: The full catalog response. self.data_types: The Oracle to JSON data type translations. self.endpoints: All endpoints. self.schemas: Schemas for all endpoints.

Parameters:

endpoint (str, optional) – The API endpoint for the catalog.

get_items(endpoint: str, params: dict | None = None) → list[dict]

Retrieves a list of items from the specified endpoint.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to query.

  • params (dict, optional) – The request parameters.

Returns:

A list of items from the response.

Return type:

list[dict]

get_json(endpoint: str, params: dict = {}) → dict

Sends a GET request to the specified endpoint and returns the response as JSON.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to query.

  • params (dict, optional) – The request parameters.

Returns:

The JSON response from the API.

Return type:

dict

get_record_count(endpoint: str) → int

Retrieves the number of records available at the specified endpoint.

Parameters:

endpoint (str) – The endpoint exposing database table data.

Returns:

The number of records available at the endpoint.

Return type:

int
